result.execSummary:
The defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financial obligations added to payment plan.
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within the next 7 days.

Defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement is Def plea G to Ct 2 10 days jail, costs, DNA. Def pleads Guilty admits repeater. Ct 1 DRI. Ct accepts plea and finds def guilty. State has complied with victim rights, neither party have accrued medical expenses. Atty Randtke/Def  comments on sentencing.  Sentenced  10days jail, CTS 10 days, $465.15, DNA within 7 days.  Days to pay scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 08:00 am.

15CM204 Spec prosecuter assigned Atty Kressel reassigned. Status Conference 4/4/17 9am DAP, comments on bail in. Bail/bond reinstated comply with conditions of ES all non monetary conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux not in court, defendant in custody From Dodge.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court.   15CF235, 15CM204. Roy Corgie is on the phone. Atty comments needs to get sched back on the Trial cala. Resolve the big trial. case. Roy comments he does not have someone set at prosc. not his sched. CT looks at setting a trial date in March for the Big case. Def comments release date is Feb 28, 2017. Last week in March for a trial. Ct will wait until Procs is assigned. March 30 adn 31 are tentitve dates. the mism case will also wait for prosc. Atty comments on addressing bail.  Review scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Attorney S. Joseph Randtke in court, defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux not in court, in custody appear by phone.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.15CF235,15CF204. Def is as Dodge Corr. 15CF235 have a JT date set. def filed motion to have special prosc. appt'd.  Atty comments no witness necessary, just facts- would like to hear motion now. DA comments agrees in some parts- the informations set forth are correct, the states motion of limine adds to the motion filed. Back on record. Ct reviewed written motions from parties. Ct agress with the defense. The allged vic told ADA test. was a lie. then the next day said it was not a lie. CT grants motion to call Ruth Kressel as a witness. Denies states motion to surpess subpeona. Grants motion for special pros. and adj's trial. CT will fill out paperwork for special pros. ADA  would like to talk to Kelly Mcknight. Phone or video for def to appear any order for transport is cancelled.  Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 01:10 pm.

Defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. STC 15CM204 and 15CF235. Sentencing after Revocation on 13CF161,14CF163,14CF199,15CF74 and 15CF109. State has complied with victim rights. ADA no agreement on sentencing. Def mother makes a statement.  ADA parties have discussed, no agreement. ADA has submitted State's recommendation is outlined in attached document. 
Atty Randtke, comments on Revocation Order and Warrant and 2 cases make def ineligible for programming request to restructure so that def is eligible for programming. 
Ct sentences def (see attached). Ct advises written explaination of determinate sentence.
